122.content:
Jensen Ackles lay unconscious, just beginning to stir. The last thing he remembered before blacking out was that he was getting close... Getting close to the big, shocking twist at the end of the next episode's script. Jensen squinted blearily in all directions. He tried to move and immediately felt his back protest. Was he sleeping on a table? What the hell..? The surroundings didn't seem completely alien, but he didn't recognize where he was at first. Jensen groaned under his breath as he sat up and smacked his lips. He tasted something bitter... Had he been roofied?

Must have been some strong stuff, because the next thing he spotted blew his mind: he was sitting on a oversized copy of the script! He yelped, scrambling to his feet. He suddenly recognized that he was still in his trailer at the studio! But everything was bloomed into enormous proportions... A pale sheen of nervous sweat dotted his forehead as he heard rumbling movement from the other side of the door. As his luck would have it, Jared was knocking, coming to check in on him. He could hear Jared shifting, getting ready to come in, and knew he had only seconds to make up his mind.
122.title: Shrinking

choices: "Why don't I sneak you out with me?"
1222.content:
Jared strolls in, clearly feeling as at home in this break area as he would in his own.

"Hey. Jensen, I dunno if you heard but we're shooting scene four first. So whenever you're ready..."

Jensen stumbled back in mute horror as Jared's behemoth frame lumbered over unaware of his tiny friend. Jared's eyes were seemingly entire building stories overhead. the vast gaze sweep over the couch and chair, places a human being was expected to recline.

"Jensen?" Jared frowned at the lack of an answer.

"H-hey." Jensen raised his voice. Jared turned around and just about passed out when he caught sight of a half foot Jensen standing on the script.

"Holy shit."

"Yeah, you're telling me."

"No, Jensen." Jared said with a daunting intensity. "You don't understand... This was in the script. I mean only for a little bit! But weren't actually supposed to..." He shook his head. Jensen took a few more steps back as he earthquake footsteps hurried to his side and Jared's face filled his vision. Jensen scratched the back of his neck awkwardly and swallowed hard.

"What the hell do we do, man?" He asked.

Jared bit his lower lip, sizing him up. "Well..."
1222.title: Jared finds him

13.content: Pick a transformation for Sam Winchester
13.title: Sam

choices: A young woman spots Sam and screams
131.content:
Leaves crashed as Sam and Dean barreled through the forest. Minutes ago, they had been hunting down an alleged sprite livng in nothern Connecticut. It turned out, the sprite was very real and spat acid when threatened. And now they were running from it, instead, as they hurried to make it to the impala for backup supplies.

"I really think we should have let animal control take this one!" Sam panted.
"Where's your sense of good-old-American adventure?" Dean shouted back, enthrall we by the hunt depsute the fear.
Sam scoffed, but didn't bother answering. Suddenly he cried out as the pixie, about three feet tall with fish like facial features, leapt and bit the base of his neck. He heard Dean shout, gunshots firing and a dead weight dropping from his back. But all he could hear was the ringing in his ears... The pain in his back. Dean crouched in front of him, more worried than ever.
"D-dean..?" Sam slurred, frowning. His brother was shrinking! "Dean! You.. You're getting smaller..?"
"More like the the other way around." Dean said grimly. Sam stopped around 30 feet tall, his head bumping the branches of the trees.
"Holy shit... What should we do?"
131.title: Growth

choices: Something tries to attack them that night
1312.content:
Sam looked down at his brother....way down. His clothes felt extremely tight and the pain started leaving him.
"Don't worry Sammy," Dean said, looking up "We'll get this taken care of".
Sam let out a smirk and chuckled, "I'm not in a rush Dean. I mean, check this out, I thought I was taller than you before. Now I'm a giant!"
Sam did a couple of muscle man poses and Dean closed his eyes, shaking his head.
"Yeah, okay Sam, so tell me what your brilliant plan is when someone comes along and sees your huge ass?"
Sam smirked again, "The first thing you think of is my huge ass? Dean, if you liked it that much, you should have told me".
Dean waved his arms, "Yeah yeah. Well, it's starting to get dark and there is no way we are getting a hotel room with you being this big, so we'll have to bunk here in the forest for the night".

Sam just nodded and laid down, picking Dean up in his hand.
"Hey, what gives?!"
"Just thought you'd want to sleep somewhere comfy tonight" Sam said, placing his big...little brother on his chest.
Dean had to admit, when he laid down, it was pretty comfy but he didn't want to let Sam know that. So he closed his eyes and fell asleep.
1312.title: Show off to dean

13121.content:
Sam and Dean slept heavily, feeling relatively secure about being in the woods. There isn't much that could have done any harm to them at the moment, anyway. Vengeful yet cautious, the other sprite approached Sam, who didn't seem to notice. Testing the hunter's sensitivity, it lightly nudged him. Sam twitched but didn't wake. However, airing on the side of caution, the sprite waited for Sam to settle back into full slumber. It watched, as the hours passed, for any sign of discomfort or awakeness. Sam slept in an almost dead-to-the-world sort of way. As the birds roused and dawn came, the sprite no longer cared about surviving, only causing greater discomfort for the two hunters that had killed its friend. It lunged out and bit down hard on the side of Sam's free hand. Sam sat up, instantly wide awake, with a yelp. Dean woke immediately after Sam.

Sam shook his hand, trying to dislodge the sprite, but it wasn't helping. In fact, it only seemed to have gotten worse. Dean got up and hurried to the Impala, grabbing the gun he had used to kill the last sprite. "Sam, hold still!" he snapped at Sam. Sam immediately obeyed, allowing Dean to shoot the sprite. However, despite being dead, the sprite hadn't been dislodged. "Okay, stay still, I'm gonna get it out." he said as he put the gun back. He hurried over and grabbed hold of the sprite's head. Or what was left of it anyway. The entire back of the sprite's skull had been blown off. Using utmost care, Dean pulled the teeth out of Sam's hand, then stepped away. "There…"

"Dean, I feel…kinda funny…" Sam mumbled. Dean frowned before it clicked, then hurried to his car. He closed the trunk of the Impala and drove it a little further away. Sam was already growing. The look of discomfort was unmistakeable on Sam's face. When the growth stopped, he towered over every tree in sight at almost a hundred feet tall. Dean felt an animalistic fear hit him as he stared up at his big little brother. Sam bent over and looked around. "Dean? Dean, where are you? This isn't funny." Sam whined. Dean quickly realized that Sam was afraid that he'd smushed Dean.

Dean stepped out towards Sam, who didn't seem to see him. "Hey, Sammy, down here!!" he called up. Sam twisted toward the voice and looked down. The second Sam's eyes found Dean, Sam sighed. "Jeez'! Think you could /not/ gale-force me with morning breath!?"

Sam blushed slightly. "Uh, sorry… just…I'm just glad you're okay." Sam admitted.

"Still like being a freakishly tall Sasquatch?" Dean teased.

"No… This sorta sucks." Sam confessed. "I mean, being a lot bigger than you is cool and all, but being this big just sucks."

Dean sighed and came closer, every hunting instinct screaming for him to turn and run. He ignored them as best he could, but every step forward made it that much worse. Like trying to walk away when stuck by a bungie cord. "Dude, you're fudging massive!" Dean blurted, unable to force himself any closer.

Sam shifted under Dean's stare. "Uh, Dean, you're, uh, making me kinda uncomfortable." he said sheepishly.
13121.title: That's Just Not Fair

131211.content:
Dean shook his head to rid himself of his own fears, now acknowledging that Sam was just as freaked, if not more than, as he was. Sam shifted again, still distressed and unnerved. "Hey, don't worry about it, Sammy. We'll figure this out. Alright?" Dean said in an effort to comfort his big little brother.

"How? I mean, I was a freak before, and that's bad enough, but this is way worse!" Sam moaned, dropping his head into his hands.

Dean came closer. "Sammy… Yeah, sure, this is a mess, but we've been in worse situations before. It could be worse!" Dean pressed.

Sam huffed out a laugh and almost scowled at Dean, but refrained himself from doing so. "How!? How could this POSSIBLY be any worse!?!"

Dean smirked slightly. "It coulda been me."

Sam froze in the middle of turning to yell at his brother as the words sunk in. He frowned and tilted his head slightly. "What's that supposed to mean?"

Dean spread his arms out. "Dude, I eat, like, four times as much as you do! And I don't eat rabbit food! You do! How do you think that'd turn out?!"

Sam thought about it for a second, then a smile broke out across his face. "Yeah, I guess you /would/ kinda suck."

Dean glared up at Sam, then gave a sideways nod. "Yeah, and you're bitchy. I wouldn't last five minutes before you'd be whining about everything I do."

Sam gave Dean a brief bitchface. "Well I wouldn't have to if you'd exhibit some form of self control."

"And I wouldn't be able to eat without you judging me."

Sam chuckled. "You'd judge me for eating plants."

Dean huffed. "Yeah, well, I'll be eating people food. You can stay here."

"Wait, you're just gonna ditch me…?" Sam asked in a sad tone as his facial features echoed the hurt feeling.

Dean internally winced, having not meant to make matters any worse. "No. At least, not completely. I was gonna get food and come back. Jeez'. Whiny much." he teased, hoping that would cheer Sam back up. Unfortunately, Sam had shut down. Dean moved in closer. "Sammy, come on. I wouldn't do that to you." Dean pressed, desperate to get Sam out of his current state-of-mind.
131211.title: Big Brother Style

choices: vegetarian for Sam, quick drive for Dean
1312111.content:
Sam looked down at Dean, eyes pleading. "Promise me, Dean. That you won't go." Sam said softly.

Dean smiled sadly up at Sam. "Promise. 'Sides, somebody's gotta watch out for your huge ass." Dean teased lightly, sticking to safe jokes he knew wouldn't upset Sam. Sam's mouth twitched, showing a ghost of a grin, before slipping back into the sad expression. Dean faked annoyance. "We're not gonna hafta or anything, are we? I mean, sure, I'll give you one if you need it, but I don't wanna know how big a chick flick you're gonna turn our lives into /now/." Dean whined.

Sam smiled and huffed out a laugh. Dean smiled on the inside and head back to the Impala, only to be stopped as something grabbed the back of his shirt. Suddenly, the ground was out from under his feet. He let out a half-terrified half-indignant yelp, realizing who it was. Almost as suddenly as he was picked up, he was being pressed into something warm and relatively comfortable. It took him a few seconds to realize he was being pressed into Sam's shoulder. "Thanks, Dean." Sam said finally, after a minute or two of silence.

Dean rolled his eyes. "Yeah, yeah. Just put me down. Gotta move the car." Dean huffed.

Sam gave a slight nod. "Right, sorry." Sam gently and carefully put Dean back down. "Sorry. I just-"

"Dude! Relax a little!" Dean cut in. Sam winced slightly. "That's enough apologizing for one day, okay?" Sam nodded. "Exactly, so just take it easy, alright?" Sam nodded again. Dean got in the Impala and moved it to a slightly safer spot. "Okay, so what's the food plan?" Dean asked the instant he got back out of the car.
1312111.title: Simple Words

13121112.content:
Sam sighed and started to get up, but hesitated. Glancing down at the Impala and Dean, he gave an absent nod. "I'll, uh, go find something to eat. You go ahead and, uh, stop by the motel. We're gonna need help. Ya' know, to fix my problem. And, uh, get a blanket too."

Dean gave Sam an amused look. "The heck you need a blanket for?"

Sam gave Dean a bitchface and huff. "It's not for me." he said bluntly.

Dean slowly understood what Sam meant. "Dude, I don't need a-"

"You started shivering a lot last night. I…I don't want to-"

"Yeah, yeah, I get it. But be careful. Okay?" Dean said warmly.

"Yeah. I will." Sam agreed with a nod. Dean drove off. Sam stood up carefully and began to walk, looking for something to eat. Several minutes of searching passed before he got too tired and hungry to keep going. With a sigh, he plopped down and looked around. "Guess I'm gonna settle for this." Sam muttered. He pulled a handful of leaves off the tree closest to him and, with a sigh, stuffed them into his mouth. Surprised at the edible-ness of the leaves, he continued to eat until he was full. Then he sighed and got comfortable.

The was a soft giggle coming from nearby. Sam turned towards the source, only to find a find little girl of 4-6. He smiled sheepishly at her and she smiled back. She then proceeded to climb up his pants leg and sit on his lap, looking for all the world as though she was sitting on the lap of a parent and not the lap of a giant, strange man. He looked around for where she may have come from to see a playground full of small children. There were some other children looking at him. He felt more than a bit embarrassed for not having seen the playground beforehand. The children looking at him began approaching, attracting the attention of even more children. The small group climbed onto his lap as well. If it weren't for the first kid sitting on his lap already, he would have already left. But now that the girl was settled he didn't have the heart to move her. And he definitely didn't have the heart to touch her for fear of hurting her. The new kids settled on his lap, followed by more and more until the playground only had six or seven kids left. His heart felt like too at this point. Some of the kids on his lap had fallen asleep and others were looking up at him with puppy dog eyes that could rival his own. The only thing he was worried about now was how the adults in charge would handle this. He knew he wouldn't be able to move until the kids got off his lap.
13121112.title: Breakfast and Children

choices: Dean helps get the kids down
131211122.content:
Sam smiled fondly at the little kids on his lap. One started to fall sideways, so he raised his arms and used them as barricades to keep any more children from almost falling. Then he heard a shriek of alarm and flinched, jostling a few children in doing so. Three of the jostled children began to cry, having been interrupted from their naps. Sam's eyes softened and, utilizing the extreme care he had been taught and raised to have, gently picked them up held them to his chest. "Hey, hey, hey. Don't cry, okay? I know you're tired and I'm sorry I woke you. It's okay." Sam murmured softly. After a minute or so of soft-spoken words and gentle hushing, the three were fast asleep, clinging to the plaid shirt so tightly he didn't want to risk trying to pry them off. So instead he looked around for the source of the shriek. His eyes widened from 'cute' to 'deer caught in headlights' as he spotted several older women that he recognized to be teachers staring and gaping at him. "Oh crap… I-I uh…" The teachers quivered at the sound of his voice. "H-hey. Uh…d-don't freak out…? Please? I-I didn't see the playground and I just stopped for breakfast and she got on my lap and I didn't know what to do. I'm scared I'll hurt them if I try to get up and I'm more scared I'll hurt them if I grab them. I didn't…" he babbled nervously. He paused, seeing the looks of disbelief and fear now replaced by amusement and unstable calm. "M-My name's Sam. I'm just waiting for my big brother. His name's Dean and he went somewhere else for breakfast. And, as you can probably tell, I ate my veggies." Sam joked shyly.

"We work at the school down the block. I'm Jackie, that's June, and that's April." one of the teachers said, still seeming uncomfortable with him but not quite scared anymore.

"Yeah. I can tell teachers apart from other people easy. Too bad my life's as messed up as it is. Made it to Stanford. Had a future for two years. Then, for no reason whatsoever, my apartment catches fire and my brother shows up in time to drag me out. The fire took my girlfriend. Can't go back now. Too many memories." Sam muttered sadly. Shaking his head to clear the depressing thoughts away, he focused on them again. "I take it this is a preschool class? They don't look much older than maybe kindergarten at most." June nodded.

The Impala pulled up as Dean stared baffledly at Sam. He'd seen the women staring at something, but to see Sam sitting so close to a playground was definitely the least expected thing he'd guessed. Sam's eyes focused on the Impala and he gave a sheepish smile. "Damnit, Sam…" Dean muttered.

"Hey, Dean. Uhhh…sorry about…ya' know. C-could you lend me a hand over here?" Sam called out softly. He winced as Dean laid on the horn. "It's not as bad as it looks. But I seriously need a hand."

The three teachers were more startled at the honk of a car horn than at the name. But what startled them most was that the extreme height difference between the two brothers. "That's your brother?" April asked.

Sam nodded and lowered one arm to tap the ground nervously. Dean facepalmed at the sight of so many kids sitting on his brother's lap. "What!? Did you just let them all swarm on top of you?! The hell were you thinking, Sam?!!" Dean snapped.

Sam lowered his head slightly. "I didn't see the playground. I sat down and heard giggling and this little girl climbed on my lap before I could think of anything to do. I need help getting them all down. I'm scared to try grabbing them or even just stand up." Sam sighed.

Dean groaned. "Of course. Leave it to you to let a bunch of kids climb on your lap. Damnit, Sammy! At least half of them are guilt-tripping me!"

Sam lowered his head even more and looked up at Dean through his bangs. "Please, Dean? I didn't see the playground until it was too late. Just…please?"
131211122.title: The Big-Hearted Giant (Darnit Sam)

1312111221.content:
Dean walked up to Sam's arm. "Gonna need a lift here, dude." Dean huffed. Sam nodded and laid his hand down, palm open. Dean climbed on and was lifted onto Sam's lap. Sighing, Dean began carrying one kid at a time to Sam's hand. It took several handfuls to get all the children off Sam's lap. Then Dean noticed the three attached to Sam's shirt. "Dammit." he muttered. Sam looked sheepishly at his brother. "Gonna need a lift." Dean grumbled. Sam nodded and gave Dean a boost. Dean had some difficulty getting the children off Sam's shirt, but once he had they started crying. "Son of a bitch. Are you fucking kidding me!?" Sam couldn't work up the courage to glare or scold Dean for his language.

Once the three kids were down, Dean sat down, looking cross. The teachers got the kids down and led the class back to the school. Sam moved to set Dean down, but Dean didn't get down. "Crap. You're really made at me, aren't you?" Sam whined. "I didn't mean for it to happen! But it did and I can't say it wasn't kinda nice."

Dean scowled. "It was too fucking close! You coulda gotten into way more trouble!" Dean spat.

Sam flinched slightly at that and lowered his head. "I know, I know. I'm sorry." Sam said somberly.

"Sorry doesn't change the fact that you coulda gotten us both into more trouble than we can get out of!"

Sam fell silent, head low. Then he stood and dropped Dean next to the Impala. "You go on back to the motel, I'll stay by myself tonight." Sam mumbled, turning and walking away.

Dean's eyes widened as he realized that he'd upset Sam. "Hey, Sam, come on! I didn't mean it like that!! …Sammy…" Dean sighed, shoulders slumping.
1312111221.title: Helping Hands, Irritated Big Brother

choices: Sam goes back to the Impala
Dean and Sam go to sleep
13121112211.content:
Dean slumped, guilt drowning him unforgivingly. He glanced up and nodded to himself when he realized that Sam was still in view. He ran after his little brother, desperate to make up for his actions. As he began nearing Sam, he began trying to get Sam's attention. "Hey! Sammy! Come on! Stop! I gotta talk to you!" he called up. Sam ignored him, and he knew Sam was ignoring him because Sam had started walking faster. "Aw, come on!! Sam! Sam!! Slow down!! I need to talk to you!!" he tried again. Sam ignored him but didn't try to walk any faster.

Sam continued walking just fast enough that Dean had to sprint to keep up until Dean's voice became unsteady. He slowed down a little, but Dean's voice remained weaker and more strained, and then it stopped altogether. Concerned, he stopped and looked back. Dean had collapsed. "Dean?" Sam asked worriedly, fully turning around. Dean didn't respond. Sam walked back to Dean and knelt down. "Dean?" he asked again, lightly nudging Dean with a finger. Dean remained limp and unmoving. Sam gently picked Dean up. "Hey, y-you still wanna talk?" he asked with a shaky grin, which dropped when Dean still didn't react. Sam sighed sadly and looked Dean over. Dean had overexerted himself. "Didn't even bring a blanket…" he muttered forlornly.

Dean woke a few hours later. Sam was awake instantly. "Sam…?" Dean asked, voice hoarse.

"You collapsed. Had me worried, •••hole." Sam sighed, offering a finger to help Dean up. Dean accepted the help. "You still wanna talk?"

Dean nodded a few times. "Yeah. I-I… Sammy… I didn't mean it. Back there, I mean. I just freaked out. You coulda been hurt or something and I…" Dean dropped his head for a moment, then brought it back up. "Look, Sam, I'm sorry about earlier. I shouldn't have… I'm just sorry, alright!"

Sam smiled a bit unsteadily. "You didn't bring a blanket with you." he pointed out. Dean laughed.
13121112211.title: Apologies and Comforts

choices: Dean goes to cheer Sam up
13121112212.content:
Dean straightened and walked back to the Impala. "I should give him some time. He just needs some time. I need some too." Dean told himself as he got in the car. "But dammit all. I shoulda been a little gentler."

Sam sat down in the clearing. "I'm too big a risk. I almost got us both in trouble. Even as a giant I'm a screw-up." Sam scolded himself. "Idiot! I coulda gotten Dean arrested and me killed! Not that I'd mind dying at all..." He sighed and curled up, continuing to cry to silently. "No. I cant leave here again. I'll just get us in more trouble..." he decided, hanging his head. "Dean shouldn't have to deal with me. I'm a freak, a monster. He should've killed me when he had the chance."

Dean sat on his bed in his motel room. Bobby had told him to wait there, so he might as well. "Sammy... I'm sorry..." he thought again as the memory of Sam's poorly concealed sorrow appeared in his head again.
13121112212.title: Mistakes and Grief

choices: Dean tries to convince Sam he's not a freak
Dean loses his lunch to guilt
131211122121.content:
Dean had nodded off at some point. His head shot up at the sound of a truck engine. He ran outside. Bobby gave him a strange look. "Idjit." Bobby huffed. "Where's yer brother?"

Dean sighed. "Somewhere in the woods. I had to get a bunch of little kids off his lap and I got mad at him for letting so many of them climb on top of him. He got upset and left." Dean explained solemnly.

"Idjit! Don't you think yer brother's got enough problems already?!" Bobby scolded.

Dean nodded. "I'm gonna talk to him, just thought I oughta wait for you." Dean answered.

Bobby huffed and got in his truck while Dean got in the Impala. Dean took the same route he and Sam had taken to get to the sprite. He didn't have to drive long before he found Sam sitting curled up in a ball. He got out and heard Bobby do the same. "Sammy?" Dean asked.

Sam sniffed loudly and raised his head. "What? What're you doing here?" Sam asked in a watery voice.

Dean swallowed down his discomfort and stepped forward. "Sammy? You alright?" he asked softly.

"'M fine. Why're you here?" Sam asked again.

"I wasn't gonna leave you all alone, Sam. I-"

"Yeah, freaks shouldn't be left on their own, I guess. Sorry. Stupid question." Sam said sadly.

"What? You're not a freak, Sammy. Never-"

"Everybody tells me so. You, Castiel, you again, most of the angels, other monsters, demons, more you, more monsters, Cas's face every time he looks at me. Only person who hasn't called me a freak is Bobby. Even dad called me a freak once. And if mom was alive, she'd have called me a freak too." Sam huffed, shoulders raising defensively. "Don't tell me I'm not a freak after telling me I am for years. It doesn't work that way and you know it."

"Idjit!" Bobby scolded Dean as he whacked the older Winchester over the head with his cap.

Dean's face drained of color as Sam's words sank in. Even with all their run ins with the Supernatural, Sam had been called a freak more times by Dean than anything else. He felt sick.
131211122121.title: Idjits, Idjits Everywhere

choices: Sam starts to accept his new size
Sam finds out Dean has a thing for giants
131212.content:
Dean just couldn't take his eyes off his enormous brother.
"Okay, but just think how mant more bad guys we can get with you being this big!"
Sam rolled his eyes "and think of how many hunters are gonna come after me cause I'm a giant."
Dean walked closer to Sam "yeah but you're a good giany Sammy, I mean, I don't think you are gonna go all destructive....right?"
Sam shook his head, his shaggy brown hair moving everywhere. Sam just couldn't look his older brother in the eyes, seeing as how dean was still looking over sam's huge body.
"Man sammy, you seriously are gonna be setting records. You literally are big foot now"
Sam blushed as dean walked up and gave sam's huge foot a tap.
"Okay Dean, but what are we gonna do about it?"
"I won't be able to give you a foot massage now, if that is what you mean"
"Dean, this is serious! What if I never go back to normal? "
Dean smiled andhim and sam locked eyes as dean rested on the giant foot.
"Since whem has normal been a thing for us? We will find a way sammy, trust me. Hell, I think it will be awesome if you stay this big! "
Sam thought it over. Could being a giant be cool? Could he live with it?
131212.title: Dean continues to stare

132.content:
With a demon tied to a chair, with a devils trap on the ceiling, Sam and Dean were feeling pretty good about their recent hunt.

"Let me try this one more time," Dean said with a smirk, "What do you want with us now?" The demon chuckled and Deans reaction was punching it.

"Oh, you wish you could kill me don't you? But see, my job can still be done, even in this stupid trap". At once, the demon satrted reciting latin, which the Winchesters reacted to quickly. Sam went to work on exorcising the demon and Dean walked towards the demon again to shut it up. But both were quickly thrown back by the demons power. Dean slowly opened his eyes and found the demon was looking at Sam while reciting the latin.

"Shit", Dean whispered. He knew no good was going to come out of the for Sam (and in the long run, Dean knew he'd be the one trying to fix the mess). But as he got up, the demon finished. It's head turned towards Dean, smiled, and opened it's hosts mouth, black smoke racing out. There was nothing left to do but check on Sam.
132.title: Shrinking

1321.content:
Sam woke up from a daze and found himself in an unfamiliar landscape. His vision was clearing up as well as the smoke that surrounded him. All of a sudden he heard thunder, he had to cover his ears how loud it was, but the thunder kept going into a rhythm. Next thing he knows he hears his name like an explosion. "Sammy!" Dean called out to his little brother. "Sammy, are you there?" It didn't take long for Sam to know what happened, the stupid demon shrunk him. Dean walks over to where Sam was last seen and doesn't see him; he stands there totally baffled on where his brother could be. Sam's emotion immediately went from confusion to fear when he noticed two giant black Caterpillar Akon boots. Sam was frozen in fear that his protective big brother was about to stomp him like an ant. All could do was close his eyes and wait for a reaper to claim him. Then instantly the thunder stopped, Sam opened his eyes and saw one of Dean's dirty boots right in front of his face. The stench from Dean’s gigantic feet was seeping through his old boots. "Oh god dean, when was the last time you showered?" as Sam rose his hands to cover his nose. Next thing he had to do was grab his big bro's attention. "Dean! Dean, down here! Look down!" but it was no use Dean was still standing there pondering where Sam could be. "Shit! Now what? He might wonder the house and leave me here or worst crush me..." Sam had to think quickly of what to do next and he can only of one option that he was probably going to regret.... He was going to hitch a ride on the Dean Express... It's a good thing that Sam is a good jumper with all that practice chasing monsters over tall fences. The reason why this is important is because the top of the toe of Dean's boot is a little over his head, so guessed to be about 6 centimeters. So he took a few steps back for a running start and took a huge leap onto Dean's size 10 boot. Sam went straight for the laces and hung on for dear life for what was about to occur.

“Dammit Sammy, where the hell did you go?” Dean said as he scratched his head. “I hope you went back to the hotel bro… I’m supposed to protect you man.” As Dean was talking to himself Sam was on his rank foot hearing the worry in Dean’s voice. He never knew how much Dean truly cared for him. The moment was interrupted when Dean started taking his first step forward towards the car. A rush of air pressed towards Sam’s face as Dean’s foot rose and Sam had to keep as tight grip when it descended. This rhythmic motion of Dean’s feet went continuously until he reached his car. Sam was about to get motion sickness if Dean didn’t stop when he did, the car was a good breather so to speak. “What should my next move be, I can’t be on Dean’s foot forever….. I need to get his attention somehow. Well, common sense tells me I should shoot for the ear for Dean to hear me call for help.” Sam was muttering under his breath. Sam decided to venture upward while he had the chance even though Dean is a good 180 feet tall now. From the laces of Dean’s boot Sam used them as ropes to climb up to something sopping wet. At first glance it looked like a web of tangled wet string but looking at it as a whole Sam didn’t like where he was.
